concept.title: Rolling restart of services
concept.shortdesc: To reduce or eliminate downtime for services with multiple instances, restarts one instance of the service at a time.

conbody.p: The browser interface visually indicates that a rolling restart is occurring and whether an instance is down during the restart.

When a wide area network (WAN) outage occurs, the rolling restart proceeds, and the instances on the disconnected hosts restart when the WAN is restored, though they might not restart in a rolling manner.
5) the timeout when waiting for an instance to restart before moving on to the next one is set by SERVICED_RUNLEVEL_TIMEOUT
6) An extra flag can be specified to the serviced service restart command that will trigger a non-rolling restart: {code}serviced service restart --rebalance SERVICE{code}
